text.p: Rutherford-Moran Oil Corp said Thursday that three exploratory wildcat wells drilled in the Benchamas North portion of Block B8/32 encountered non-commercial accumulations of hydrocarbons.
The company said the wildcat wells were drilled on structures some five to ten miles north of the Benchamas Field where nine successful exploratory wells have been drilled to date.
The company said Benchamas North Number 1 contained a significant amount of reservoir quality sands that were non-hydrocarbon bearing.
The company said Benchamas North Number two encountered 40 feet of net oil pay, which although non-commercial, demonstrated the northern extension of hydrocarbons.
Benchamas North Number three encountered 48 feet of net pay, an additional indication that hydrocarbon accumulations exist in the Benchamas North area, the company said.
